com.github.maxstupo.clilib

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.clilib.CommandHandler

  • public class CommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles a collection of commands, calling process(String[]) will parse the array of strings and execute the correct command.
    Author:
    Maxstupo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandHandler(IPrint print, java.lang.String prefix, java.lang.String helpCommandTitle)
      Create a new CommandHandler.

      void process(java.lang.String[] tokens)
      Process an array of strings.
      array[0] = the command key
      The rest of the array is parameters for the specific command.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandHandler

        public CommandHandler(IPrint print,
                      java.lang.String prefix,
                      java.lang.String helpCommandTitle)
        Create a new CommandHandler.
        Parameters:
        print - The interface used to display information from commands or the CommandHandler.
        prefix - The command prefix (eg. /), if null is specified no prefix will be used.
        helpCommandTitle - The title displayed in the help command information.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public void process(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        Process an array of strings.
        array[0] = the command key
        The rest of the array is parameters for the specific command.
        This method will output to the PrintStream specified by the constructor.
        Parameters:
        tokens - The array of strings to parse.

      • registerCommand

        public void registerCommand(AbstractCommand command)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers a command.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to register.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when command is null, or the commands keywords are empty.

      • unregisterCommand

        public void unregisterCommand(AbstractCommand command)
        Unregister the specified command.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to unregister.

      • getCommands

        public java.util.List<AbstractCommand> getCommands()
        Returns an unmodifiable list of commands.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of commands.
        See Also:
        Collections.unmodifiableList(List)

      • getCommandPrefix

        public java.lang.String getCommandPrefix()
        Returns the command prefix specified from the constructor.
        Returns:
        the command prefix.
